verses.verse: Now it came<WH1961> about on the third<WH7992> day<WH3117> that Esther<WH635> put<WH3847> on her royal<WH4438> robes<WH4438> and stood<WH5975> in the inner<WH6442> court<WH2691> of the king<WH4428>'s palace<WH1004> in front<WH5227> of the king's rooms,<WH1004> and the king was sitting<WH3427> on his royal<WH4438> throne<WH3678> in the throne<WH4438> room,<WH1004> opposite<WH5227> the entrance<WH6607> to the palace.<WH1004>

So Esther<WH635> answered<WH6030> and said,<WH559> "My petition<WH7596> and my request<WH1246> is:

if<WH518> I have found<WH4672> favor<WH2580> in the sight<WH5869> of the king,<WH4428> and if<WH518> it please<WH2895> the king<WH4428> to grant<WH5414> my petition<WH7596> and do<WH6213> what<WH1246> I request,<WH1246> may the king<WH4428> and Haman<WH2001> come<WH935> to the banquet<WH4960> which<WH834> I shall prepare<WH6213> for them, and tomorrow<WH4279> I will do<WH6213> as the king<WH4428> says.<WH1697> "

"Yet all<WH3605> of this<WH2088> does not satisfy<WH9586> me every<WH3605> time<WH6256> I see<WH7200> Mordecai<WH4782> the Jew<WH3064> sitting<WH3427> at the king's gate.<WH8179>"
